definition: (in former times) upper, middle and lower army/army of right, center and left/(in modern times) the three armed services: Army, Navy and Air Force
(of a team) to throw oneself into the battle

sentences.english: Minshan thousands more hi snow, after the three services do Kai-yan.

sentences.english: He said the ISI faces many questions that need answers.
sentences.chinese: 他说，三军情报局有许多问题需要回答。

sentences.english: If they listen to my techniques of management of troops, he can control the whole army as well.
sentences.chinese: 如果能听从我的统御方法，就可以驾驭三军之众。

sentences.english: The army, navy and airforce are all controlled by the Ministry of Defence.
sentences.chinese: 海陆空三军均由国防部管辖。

sentences.english: Three Armies march on with victorious smiles.

sentences.english: On Tuesday, General Kayani named General Ahmed Shujaa Pasha as the new ISI chief.

sentences.english: The explosion occurred in the Algerian armed forces Schaller Schell General Military Academy.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在阿尔及利亚舍尔沙勒三军综合军事学院。

sentences.english: Hu, accompanied by Carlos, inspected the honor guard of the three services of Spain.
